data.proposal:
# 5-Day Vacation Itinerary for Marrakech

## Overview
Begin a solo traveler's journey to Marrakech with a $900 budget, focusing on beach lounging, snorkeling, sunset cruise, hiking, and rock climbing. Explore the vibrant city of Marrakech, known for its rich history, stunning architecture, and bustling souks.

## Day 1

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Arabe (9:00 AM) with traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee ($10 per person)
- Visit the Majorelle Garden (10:00 AM), a stunning botanical garden created by French artist Jacques Majorelle, featuring vibrant gardens, fountains, and architecture. (Entrance fee: $20 per person)
- Explore the Bahia Palace Museum (11:30 AM) showcasing intricately decorated palace architecture and history. (Entrance fee: $15 per person)
- Travel time between locations: 30 minutes to 1 hour

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Comptoir Darna (1:00 PM), serving Mediterranean-inspired dishes with a focus on local ingredients ($25 per person)
- Visit the Koutoubia Mosque (2:30 PM), one of the largest mosques in Marrakech, featuring stunning architecture and historic significance. (Entrance fee: free)
- Relax at the La Mamounia Hotel's pool (4:00 PM) with a refreshing cocktail and snacks ($20 per person)

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Tobschat (6:30 PM), offering local Moroccan cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($40 per person)
- Explore the vibrant souks of Marrakech, including the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa market (7:30 PM), featuring street performers, food stalls, and local artisans. (Free entrance)

## Day 2

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café des Epices (9:00 AM) with traditional Moroccan coffee and pastries ($10 per person)
- Visit the Saadian Tombs (10:30 AM), a historic site showcasing beautifully crafted tombs and architecture. (Entrance fee: $5 per person)
- Explore the Menara Palace Museum (12:00 PM), featuring stunning gardens, fountains, and architecture. (Entrance fee: $15 per person)
- Travel time between locations: 1 hour to 2 hours

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Grand Café de la Poste (1:30 PM), serving Mediterranean-inspired dishes with a focus on local ingredients ($25 per person)
- Visit the Bahia Museum's adjacent park, Jardin du Babor (3:30 PM) for a relaxing stroll and beautiful views. (Free entrance)

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Foundouk (6:30 PM), offering local Moroccan cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($40 per person)
- Enjoy a Sunset Cruise along the Marrakech coastline, taking in stunning views of the city and ocean. (Departure time: varies)

## Day 3

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at La Maison Arabe (9:00 AM), serving traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee ($15 per person)
- Visit the Museum of Moroccan Arts and Crafts (10:30 AM), featuring local artisans, crafts, and cultural exhibits. (Entrance fee: $10 per person)
- Explore the vibrant neighborhood of Gueliz, known for its upscale boutiques, restaurants, and nightlife.

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Relais de la Vague d'Or (1:30 PM), serving Mediterranean-inspired dishes with a focus on local ingredients ($25 per person)
- Visit the Majorelle Garden's adjacent Berber Village, offering stunning views and insights into local culture. (Entrance fee: $10 per person)

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant La Maitrise des Savoie (6:30 PM), serving Mediterranean-inspired cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($40 per person)
- Explore the lively nightlife of Marrakech, featuring bars, clubs, and live music.

## Day 4

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café de la Paix (9:00 AM) with traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee ($10 per person)
- Visit the Hiking Trail to Mount Zagaloua (10:30 AM), offering breathtaking views of Marrakech and its surrounding mountains. (Entrance fee: $20 per person)

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Marché de la Poste (1:30 PM), serving local Moroccan cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($15 per person)
- Visit the Yves Saint Laurent Museum, showcasing the life and work of the famous fashion designer. (Entrance fee: $10 per person)

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Royal Marocain (6:30 PM), offering local Moroccan cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($40 per person)
- Enjoy an evening rock climbing session at the Marrakech Rock Climbing Center, suitable for beginners and experienced climbers. (Entrance fee: $25 per person)

## Day 5

### Morning (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM)
- Breakfast at Café Arabe (9:00 AM) with traditional Moroccan pastries and coffee ($10 per person)
- Visit the Hammam Badia, a historic public bathhouse offering relaxing massages and treatments. (Entrance fee: $20 per person)

### Afternoon (12:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
- Lunch at Le Comptoir Darna (1:30 PM), serving Mediterranean-inspired dishes with a focus on local ingredients ($25 per person)
- Visit the Berber Village, offering stunning views and insights into local culture. (Entrance fee: $10 per person)

### Evening (5:00 PM - 10:00 PM)
- Dinner at Restaurant Le Tobschat (6:30 PM), offering local Moroccan cuisine with a focus on fresh ingredients ($40 per person)
- Explore the vibrant souks of Marrakech, including the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa market, for last-minute shopping and souvenirs. (Free entrance)

## Practical Information

### Recommended Accommodations
- Riad Yacout (Budget: $60 per night) - A beautifully restored riad with traditional Moroccan architecture.
- Hotel Le Royal Marocain (Mid-range: $120 per night) - A luxurious hotel offering stunning views of the city and pool.
- La Mamounia Hotel (Luxury: $200 per night) - A world-renowned luxury hotel with impeccable service and amenities.

### Transportation Options
- Public transport in Marrakech is affordable, but it can be challenging to navigate. Renting a scooter or bike for the day ($15-$20) provides flexibility.
- Taxi services are widely available, but haggling is expected.

### Estimated Costs
- Accommodations: $300 (avg. $60 per night)
- Meals: $200 (avg. $40 per meal)
- Attractions and activities: $150 (avg. $30 per person)
- Transportation: $50 (avg. $10 per ride)

Total estimated cost for the 5-day trip: $900
